Load and prepare root data from CSV

Source: R/pipeline.R
prepare_root_data.Rd

Convenience wrapper that loads a GPR export CSV, fills ROOT_IDs, optionally splits the survey column, and converts coordinates.

Usage

prepare_root_data(
  path,
  sep = ",",
  skip = 1,
  root_id_col = "N.",
  x_col = "X[SRS units]",
  y_col = "Y[SRS units]",
  z_col = "Depth[m]",
  negate_z = TRUE,
  survey_col = "Survey",
  plot_position = 4
)

Arguments

path

Path to CSV file.

sep

CSV separator. Default ",".

skip

Number of header rows to skip. Default 1 (CRS metadata row).

root_id_col

Name of the root identifier column in raw CSV. Default "N.".

x_col, y_col, z_col

Names of coordinate columns.

negate_z

Negate Z values? Default TRUE.

survey_col

Name of survey column to split, or NULL to skip.

plot_position

Position of plot ID in split survey. Default 4.

Value

A cleaned data.frame ready for segment processing.

On this page

Developed by Jakub Miszczyszyn & Luiza Tymińska-Czabańska at the Faculty of Forestry, University of Agriculture in Krakow. Funded by NCN (National Science Centre, Poland).
